original_title: Sri Lanka’s mid day shares edge up on higher than expected rate cuts
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edge up in mid day trade on Thursday, over as Sri Lanka cuts policy rates 250 basis points lowering the rate at which liquidity is injected to markets to 14.0 percent to from 16.50 percent, saying inflation was falling faster than expected, an analyst said.
“The overall sentiment is positive, because it was a higher than expected rate cut,” an analyst said.

Sri Lanka’s inflation in the 12-months to May 2023 has eased to 25.2 percent from 35.3 percent a month earlier according to a revised Colombo Consumer Price Index calculated by the state statistics office.
The main All Share Price Index was up 1.32 percent or 113.23 points to 8,668.40, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was up 1.88 percent or 45.56 points to 2,467.05.
The market generated a moderate turnover of  464 million rupees.
Top gainers during mid day trade were Vallibel One, Sampath Bank & Commercial Bank. (Colombo/June01/2023)
